name: Hero Stat with Quote
description: High-impact split layout pairing a large display statistic with an expert quote, designed to anchor key data points with human context and credibility.

grid.margins: $spacing-07 (32px) gutter between stat and quote columns

components: Hero statistic: $display-02 for the number, $blue-60 color
Stat descriptor: $label-01 below the number explaining what it measures
Unit/context: $body-short-01 for unit label or time period
Quote text: $body-long-02 italic for the quotation body
Attribution: $label-02 in $text-03 for speaker name and title
rules: Statistic MUST use $display-02 in $blue-60 — this is the visual anchor of the composition
Stat descriptor uses $label-01 directly below the number with $spacing-03 gap
Split layout is 6/10 (stat left, quote right) or 10/6 (quote left, stat right) — never equal halves
Quote text uses $body-long-02 in italic style — never bold, never larger than $heading-03
Attribution line uses $label-02 in $text-03, preceded by an em-dash
Gutter between columns uses wide grid gutter ($spacing-07 / 32px)
Only one hero stat per pattern instance — multiple stats belong in kpi-grid instead
Vertical alignment is centered between stat and quote for visual balance

printBehavior.pagePosition: flexible — works on any page within body content

accessibilityNotes: Hero statistic must have aria-label providing full context (e.g., aria-label='73 percent of executives agree')
Quote text should use <blockquote> with <cite> for attribution — semantic quote markup
The split layout must linearize correctly for screen readers: stat first, then quote
Ensure $blue-60 stat number meets contrast requirements against the background
antiPatterns: Never use $heading-07 or $display-01 for the statistic — $display-02 is the correct scale for inline stats
Never place two hero-stat-with-quote patterns on the same page — one per spread maximum
Never use an 8/8 equal split — the asymmetry (6/10 or 10/6) creates visual tension and hierarchy
Never include more than one statistic — use kpi-grid for multiple metrics
Never omit the quote attribution — an unattributed quote reduces credibility
